page.title: 13DAVID LEWIS CENTRE cont.
page.content: Each resident pays Â£135 a week for a place. Practically all are sponsored by local authorities or by the DHSS. The centre has an income of Â£2.6 million a year, all of which is ploughed back in. The residents are paid for any work they do. The Government disregards the first Â£4 a week they earn but beyond that they start to lose benefit. The school staff consists of 13 well qualified full time teachers and includes specialists in Art, Home Economics, Drama and Music. On the residential side there is a total of 23 full time child_care staff. The school takes children of both primary and secondary age. There are links with the local college of further education and older children are involved in work experience programmes.
